(Verse 1)
O fairest love, that once didst bloom so bright,  
Thy tender grace, as gentle as the morn,  
Hath left mine heart in shadowed woe of night,  
Forlorn am I, as one who hath been shorn.  
Thou wast the sun that warmed mine every day,  
Yet now art fled, o'er distant hills away.  

(Chorus)  
O heart, thou break'st beneath love's cruel sting,  
For in loss's wake, no solace doth it bring,  
In dreams alone thy visage comes in view,  
Yet waking, I bemoan what love didst undo.  

(Verse 2)  
Upon the winds doth whisper thine own name,  
A balm so sweet, yet cutteth like a sword,  
Each memory fonder than a fleeting flame,  
Brings anguish of the past thus oft ignored.  
How cruel fate weaves a web where love hast flown,  
Leaving but echoes where affection shone.  

(Chorus)  
O heart, thou break'st beneath love's cruel sting,  
For in loss's wake, no solace doth it bring,  
In dreams alone thy visage comes in view,  
Yet waking, I bemoan what love didst undo.  

(Bridge)  
If tears couldst write in streams upon the ground,  
A tale of loss, the earth would drown in grief,  
Yet 'tis in silence that my soul is bound,  
Bereft of hope, seeking love's relief.  

(Finale)  
Adieu, sweet specter of my vanished joy,  
Thy memory shall henceforth be my ploy,  
To cherish what was ours in fleeting song,  
A mournful ode where only love belongs.
